it's ok when specifying a key so just needs a cosmetic fix for when the key is not specified

```
$ pulsar-admin functions querystate --fqfn public/default/yoshi -k goumba
```

> @fxbing it is a nice motivation. but I am feeling that you didn't change the code in the right place. the change in fetchPartitionedTopicMetadataAsync will introduce unnecessary creation of partitioned topic. The `auto-creation` happens when a producer or a consumer connects to broker. so I think the change should be done in `BrokerService`. You can check the methods `getOrCreateTopic`.

I first thought about making changes in the BrokerService, but when the client requests to create a Producer or Consumer, it will first get partitions info from zk, decide whether to create partitioned or non-partitioned. When the request arrives at the BrokerService, the client has decided to create a nonpartitioned Producer or Consumer. If the Broker's configuration requires automatic creation of a partitioned topic, Broker needs to send the configuration information to client, client re-establishes the partitioned Producer or Consumer, and the BrokerService updates the partitions in the zk.

I think it's easier to make changes when the client creates the type that determines the creation, and need fewer communications.

Do I need to modify it as I said above?

> Also change "partition" and "non-partition" to "partitioned" and "non-partitioned". It might be also worth considering adding an enum like `TopicType`?

OKï¼Œ I will make a change.

Sorry for not notice this. @Liu-Junlin @xixiss.
@sijie We should add doc. But after re-think of this, we may should provide a config for user to disable the auth between brokers.
currently this config is re-used at a lot of places,
```
brokerClientAuthenticationPlugin=
brokerClientAuthenticationParameters=
```
Broker internal client, Broker internal admin, Broker internal function worker will all use this. If we want to use this config in more than 1 situation, e.g. enable Broker internal client and Broker internal function worker at the same time ,but with different config, it is impossible.

It's not about the snappy version, at least not completely. `res` is an undeclared identifier for sure, and it can not be compiled from snappy 1.1.3 which is the first release on Github.

And the CI runs smoothly because the docker container has no snappy installed.

@aahmed-se what @tuteng is looking for is a mechanism (or an http endpoint) to trigger reloading connectors when people adding more connectors to the connectors directory
This will be fixed by #4963

@LeisureChou in theory you can just open a connection to a data in the constructor of the function, so that you can use the db connection in the function method.

Is that what you are looking for? Or can you describe more about what you are looking for?

@benxinglong I am not sure if this is a problem. Because sendAsync are async operations. There is no guarantee that all 10 messages are sent to the topic. You have to wait on the futures returned by sendAsync to make sure all 10 messages are produced to the topic.

Please try to wait for the last sendAsync and check if you can get the right `msgBacklog`.

@codelipenghui It might be related the issues we have seen in broker that admin requests don't timeout and block the http requests. I think there are multiple changes checked in master to make http requests async. 

If the timeout happens again, take a jstack to see if there is any http threads are blocked.

@freeznet I believe the docker image should have C++ client installed. otherwise python client is unable to be used and python functions can not be run.

@wolfstudy can you work with @freeznet to see why he can't run go function?

> Yes, my question is about this. If the bundle only contains one partition and the partition is still overloaded, is there a way to solve it? 

Currently partition is the finest granularity in Pulsar. We can't split it now. 

> Increasing partition does not work for me cause I use key hash as the routing mode while producing the messages.

Does the new subscription mode `key_shared` address your problem?

@congbobo184 Please help take a look these changes, thanks.

@sijie @wolfstudy i have located the problem. python version has a shortcut to solve the dependency problem by copy a compiled dynamic lib file called `_pulsar.so` to python's `site-packages`.

[https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-client-cpp/python/setup.py#L50](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-client-cpp/python/setup.py#L50)

for golang function, ELF will not search dynamic lib within python's site path. 

```
root@3a11cfa4af22:/pulsar# apt list | grep pulsar

WARNING: apt does not have a stable CLI interface. Use with caution in scripts.

root@3a11cfa4af22:/# find / -name "_pulsar.so"
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/_pulsar.so
```
overall looks good to me. :)
